column4: With every distro, and with most sound card drivers, MIDI appears to be an afterthought.
The only way to change the MIDI situation os to file bug reports whenever you can't get midi to work.
One of the great selling points of the Atari ST is that it came with built in midi ports which always worked with any program you installed.
Reporting bugs: When I use reportbug, it sends the bug to ubuntu-users@lists.ubuntu.com. Bugs I reported get held for moderator approval. Are the bugs going into a bitbucket?
Does Ubuntu have a bug tracking system?
bugzilla.ubuntu.com
Thanks. My bugs are being sent to ubuntu-users@lists.ubuntu.com, then being held for moderator approval (as I am not a member of that list). Do you think the system is mis-configured?
i use bugzilla. idk about mailing lists
I use reportbug. Reportbug has been configured to send to that list.
sudo is not necessary for ifconfig
ah yes. /sbin appears in a user's path on Ubuntu, but not debian. hence ifconfig is available as a user command
pm?
may i help you?
is there a problem?
Hi. The topic for discussion is using non-ascii characters. I have asked around, and it is looking corrupted for others as well. Can you change the pipe to ascii | ?
dont use !ops unless there is a noticeable problem. we are not your personal helpmates
I used !ops to determine who to tell about the corrupted topic for the group. What should I have done?
asked in the channel who was was an op. !ops is for emergency use
I have done this on two occasions in the last 20 hours.
is the topic suitable for you now?
It isn't the case of being suitable for me personally. But to look right for everybody. Thank you for makign the change.
